summary: This is an internal FBI New York email chain discussing preparation for an interview with the Acting Assistant Special Agent in Charge (ADIC) about human trafficking cases. The emails mention the need to highlight recent cases, specifically noting the exclusion of high-profile cases like Epstein, cult/sex trafficking cases, and foreign/labor cases from the briefing materials.

persons.name: Kenney
persons.role: FBI Agent handling Human Trafficking matters
persons.context: Copied on an email regarding human trafficking case preparation for an ADIC interview.

persons.name: Salter
persons.role: FBI Agent handling Human Trafficking matters
persons.context: Copied on an email regarding human trafficking case preparation for an ADIC interview.

persons.name: Hubert Dupigny
persons.role: Convicted individual in a sex trafficking case
persons.context: Referenced in a linked Department of Justice press release as a person convicted of sex trafficking offenses in Manhattan federal court.

events.title: Planned ADIC Interview on Human Trafficking
events.description: The Acting Assistant Special Agent in Charge (ADIC) is scheduled to give an interview for a monthly podcast with a radio station, with the first topic being human trafficking.

keyFacts: The FBI New York office is preparing briefing materials for an ADIC interview focused on human trafficking cases.
The briefing materials explicitly exclude high-profile cases like Epstein, cult/sex trafficking cases (referenced as 'Nexium on C-2'), and foreign/labor cases.
The email references several recent domestic human trafficking cases with strong ties to gangs, including the conviction of Hubert Dupigny.
The communication indicates an internal FBI effort to manage public messaging on human trafficking, separating high-profile matters like Epstein from other case examples.
